message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about semantic relation classification, which is a task in natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a convolutional neural network (CNN) model, which is a popular deep learning technique used in various NLP tasks, such as text classification and sentiment analysis. This makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves learning representations and negative sampling, which are common techniques in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper evaluates its method on a dataset from SemEval-2010 Task 8, which is a task in information retrieval (cs.IR) related to NLP.
